gurmukhi: n pwvY blM dyvqw jg bwsM ]BeI ieMdR kI rwjDwnI ibnwsM ]
transliteration: Na Paavai Balan Devtaa Jag Baasan|| Bhaiindra Kiraajdhaanibinaasan||
translation: There was no position of gods in the Yajnas of king Bali and the capital of Indra was also destroyed.

gurmukhi: krI jog AwrwDnw srb dyvM ]pRsMnM Bey kwl purKM AByvM ]2]
transliteration: Karijog Aaraadhanaa Sarab Devan|| Parasannan Bhae Kaal Purakhannddabhevan||2||
translation: In great agony, all the gods meditated on the Lord, by which the Supreme Destroyer Purusha was pleased.2.

gurmukhi: dIXo AwiesM kwl purKM ApwrM ]Dro bwvnw ibsn Astm vqwrM ]
transliteration: Deeyo Aaisan Kaal Purakhannddapaaran|| Ddaro Baavnaa Bisan Astam Vataaran||
translation: The Non-temporal Lord asked Vishnu out of all gods to assume his eighth manifestation in the form of Vaman incarnation.

gurmukhi: leI ibsn AwgXw cilXo Dwie AYsy ]lhXo dwrdI BUp BMfwr jYsy ]3]
transliteration: Laibisan Aagyaa Chaliyo Dhaae Aise|| Lahyo Daardibhoop Bhandaar Jaise||3||
translation: Vishnu after seeking permission of the Lord, moved like a servant at the command of a king.3.

gurmukhi: srUp Cot DwirkY ]clXo qhwN ibcwirkY ]sBw nrys jwnXo ]qhI su pwv TwnXo ]4]
transliteration: Saroop Chhodh Ddaar(i) Kai|| Chadyo Tahaan Bicdaar(i) Kai|| Sabhaa Dares Jaanyo|| Tahisu Paav Thaanyo||4||
translation: He transformed himself ad a dwarf and after some reflection, he moved towards the court of the king Bali, where, on reaching, he stood firmly.4.

gurmukhi: su byd cwr aucwrkY ]suxXo niRpM suDwr kY ]
transliteration: Su Bed Chaar Ouchaar-kai|| Sounyo Nripan Sudhaar Kai||
translation: This Brahmin recited all the four Vedas, which the king listened to attentively.

gurmukhi: bulwie ib`p ko lXo ]mlXwgr mUVkw dXo ]5]
transliteration: Bulaae Bipp Ko Layo|| Malyaagad Moondkaa Dayo||5||
translation: The king Bali then called th Brahmin and got him seated respectfully on a seat of sandalwood.5.

gurmukhi: pdrG dIp dwn dY ]pRd`Cnw Anyk kY ]
transliteration: Padargh Deep Daan Dia|| Pradachchhanaa Anek Kai||
translation: The king quaffed the water, with which the feet of the Brahmin had been washed and offered charities.

gurmukhi: kroir d`Cnw deI ]n hwQ ib`p nY leI ]6]
transliteration: Daror(i) Dachchhanaa Daee|| Na Haath Bipp Nai Laee||6||
translation: Then he circumambulated around the Brahmin several times, after that the king offered millions of charities, but the Brahmin did not touch anything with his hand.6.
